intro: Minuartia campestris, commonly known as the field mouse-ear, is a low-growing, mat-forming plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its small, rounded leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a velvety texture. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is typically found in disturbed soils and open habitats such as roadsides, fields, and rocky areas. Minuartia campestris is adapted to thrive in sunny, well-drained environments and is often found in temperate regions.
